image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Defence lawyers for accused triple-murderer Erin Patterson tell a jury she lied about a cancer diagnosis and foraging mushrooms, but is innocent of murdering three relatives with a poisoned meal.

title.children: 'Panicked' Erin Patterson lied to police but is innocent of triple murder, court hears

image.altText: A man with stubble and grey hair films a video on social media

props.synopsis: Brian Barnes faces court over an alleged assault while in custody, with prosecutors applying for access to body-worn camera and CCTV footage.

title.children: Man accused of murdering former teacher faces court on assault charges

image.altText: Monique Ryan Amelia Hamer pre-poll signs

props.synopsis: Liberals say the Boroondara City Council threatened Amelia Hamer's implied constitutional freedom of political communication when it took down her signs.

title.children: Kooyong corflute kerfuffle headed for court as Liberals cry foul at council

image.altText: Corella dead on Wimmera riverfront

props.synopsis: Agriculture Victoria and the Conservation Regulator are investigating, after the council said the incident at Horsham appeared to be the result of illegal poisoning.

title.children: Dozens of dead birds found by river in case of suspected poisoning

image.altText: images of Jacinta Nampijinpa Price and Malarndirri McCarthy in front of an Aboriginal flag

props.synopsis: Indigenous leaders say they "despair" that culture wars and "nasty narratives" have trumped ambitious policy in the campaign's final stretch.

title.children: 'Dog whistling' and 'broken promises': Groundhog Day for Indigenous policy

image.altText: A man grabs his jumper and gestures to the crowd.

props.synopsis: Sydney premiership coach Paul Roos has called on the AFL world to give Western Bulldogs star forward Jamarra Ugle-Hagan some space to breathe in light of him taking time away from the club.

title.children: Coaching greats calls on AFL world to give Ugle-Hagan 'time to breathe'

image.altText: Kane Cornes

props.synopsis: The Kangaroos confirm they have banned Channel 7 pundit Kane Cornes from talking to players and coaches over "vindictive attacks" aimed at North Melbourne stars.

title.children: 'Bullying behaviour': Clarkson and Kangaroos ban Channel 7 pundit from interviews

image.altText: Pedestrians shelter from rain under umbrellas in a wet city.

props.synopsis: A run of showery and stormy days is soaking Australia's east coast, while a record drought across South Australia and Victoria continues to intensify.

title.children: East coast drenching set to continue as SA, Vic struggle through big dry

image.altText: Andrew Lethlean addressing media with Nationals leader David Littleproud and senator Bridget McKenzie standing behind him.

props.synopsis: Nationals candidate Andrew Lethlean could face thousands of dollars in fines after selling alcohol at his Bendigo bar while its licence was suspended.

title.children: Nationals candidate Andrew Lethlean under pressure over lapsed liquor licence

image.altText: An ambulance parked at the Alfred Hospital in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Ambulance Victoria's CEO says he's aware of two COVID-era 'honour guards' for deceased paramedics that took place at a time when Victorians were living under strict rules for gatherings.

title.children: Ambulance Victoria admits to second illegal COVID-era gathering

image.altText: shac teal

props.synopsis: The Climate 200 founder lit a fire that could clear a path for independents to decide the next government. They say his influence ends there.

title.children: Holmes à Court fuels movement that denies he will have seat at table

image.altText: A picture of St Kilda AFL coach Ross Lyon standing on the sidelines at Docklands looking out on the field during a match.

props.synopsis: Ross Lyon hits out at the VFL after Alix Tauru was suspended for four weeks before a two week bye.

title.children: Saints coach 'absolutely filthy' about rookie's suspension, takes aim at VFL

image.altText: George Hewett is hugged by Patrick Cripps and teammates

props.synopsis: Carlton strings together three straight victories to get back into the finals mix led by a player who many consider to be an afterthought outside the club. Here's what we learned from round seven of the AFL season.

title.children: Carlton's season is alive again, and an unheralded hero has resuscitated it

image.altText: A man with a brunette mullet in a black shirt smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: When Brett Blake was 17, he was charged with inciting a riot, disorderly conduct and assaulting a public officer. His MICF Most Outstanding Show-nominated stand-up hour calls for second chances.

title.children: This comedian almost went to jail at 17. His show is about second chances

image.altText: A middle-aged man holding a rusty old rod by the ocean

props.synopsis: A long-lost game fishing rod has been dredged up by crew members of a trawler after spending four decades on the ocean floor offshore from Bermagui on the NSW far south coast.

title.children: Fishing rod returned to owner 40 years after it was lost at sea

image.altText: Dean Hurlston sits in front of a computer displaying a Victorian Ombudsman report.

props.synopsis: An inner-city Melbourne mayor has been granted an interim personal safety intervention order against the head of Council Watch, Dean Hurlston, over alleged harassment.

title.children: Council Watch head hit with interim court order over alleged harassment of mayor

image.altText: Purple sign reads "voting centre"

props.synopsis: Advance Australia is one of several relatively new groups aiming to replicate the success of activists on the left, but confronts a more fragmented right.

title.children: A constellation of conservative groups has altered the campaign landscape

image.altText: Samreen takes a selfie with a scenic backdrop

props.synopsis: As debate around international student numbers intensifies, a report reveals they experience poorer mental health than their domestic counterparts.

title.children: What it’s really like to be an international student in Australia

image.altText: An in-flight picture of an airliner over a beach, the plane in purple and white livery showing the word "Bonza".

props.synopsis: Bonza promised to shake up the aviation industry by offering cheap flights to destinations ignored by the bigger airlines. But it did not take long for the cracks to appear.

title.children: It's one year since Bonza went bust. Will it ever be replaced?

image.altText: Josh Sinn's head hits the ground in a tackle by Paul Curtis

props.synopsis: North Melbourne's Paul Curtis remains suspended for three matches after losing his challenge to a rough conduct charge at the AFL tribunal.

title.children: Curtis fails to overturn three-game dangerous tackle ban

image.altText: A man in handcuffs arrives at a court building with a police officer.

props.synopsis: Thomas Towle has faced a litany of new driving charges almost 20 years after killing six teenagers in a fatal crash near Mildura.

title.children: Man convicted of killing teens in car crash avoids jail on new charges

image.altText: An apple and a punnett of apples.

props.synopsis: An agreement being reached on fruit fly protocols means apples from the Australian mainland can now be exported to China.

title.children: Apple growers no longer at mercy of supermarkets with China agreement

image.altText: Female Victoria Police officer with her back to camera.

props.synopsis: Three years after Victoria Police stood up a new unit to investigate family violence by serving officers, women say they've faced shocking treatment and even criminal charges themselves after gathering the courage to report abuse.

title.children: Women reported rape, assault by cops. Police investigation was a new trauma

image.altText: Jamrra Ugle-Hagan walks off the ground

props.synopsis: Jamarra Ugle-Hagan takes a leave of absence from the Western Bulldogs as he deals with personal issues.

title.children: Ugle-Hagan takes indefinite personal leave from Bulldogs

image.altText: Yayoi Kusama, with bright red hair, smiles and waves seated at bench covered in vibrant coloured prints also in background.

props.synopsis: Financial support for artists, local content quotas for streaming platforms and AI regulation are on the agenda this election.

title.children: Arts is a $64 billion industry — so why aren't the leaders talking about it?

image.altText: Nathan Brown promotes a multi bet on television.

props.synopsis: The Sportsbet "live odds" segments hosted by former player Nathan Brown was an AFL television broadcast mainstay for years. Why have they suddenly stopped?

title.children: After the losses were revealed, these Sportsbet TV segments stopped

image.altText: Three Carlton players - with Peter Bosustow in the middle - crouch down for a picture with another player standing behind them.

props.synopsis: High-flying Western Australian footballer Peter Bosustow dies at 67, with former Carlton teammates and coaches paying tribute to the exciting dual premiership player known as "the Buzz".

title.children: VFL high flyer Peter 'the Buzz' Bosustow dies aged 67

image.altText: Headshot of Aunty Joy wearing classes and a possum fur coat.

props.synopsis: Aunty Joy Murphy Wandin says she doesn't know if she could work with Melbourne Storm again after the NRL club cancelled her Welcome to Country ceremony on Anzac Day.

title.children: Aboriginal elder told Welcome to Country 'inappropriate' on Anzac Day

image.altText: drone shot of a hospital sitting among leafy suburban streets

props.synopsis: I've seen the future of an important part of Australia's healthcare system — a private hospital owned by a health insurance company.

title.children: A private hospital opens in Melbourne with no out-of-pocket costs

image.altText: Raw lamb chops.

props.synopsis: China grants access to more Australian lamb and mutton as it looks for other markets during the trade war with US President Donald Trump.

title.children: More Aussie sheep meat will be sent to China as trade wars continue

image.altText: Founder of the Baai Alkebu-lan African Library Arts and Cultural Centre Magang Reech reads a book in front of the bookshelf.

props.synopsis: Nestled in the heart of Footscray in Melbourne's inner-west sits a trove of African art, literature and history. Its founder hopes it will become a source of community strength for generations to come.

title.children: In Footscray's heart, this library brings Africa's rich history to life

image.altText: Peter Dutton, wearing a navy suit jacket with pale blue shirt and lilac tie, speaks in front of blue corflute

props.synopsis: Crime and policing are state issues, but with recent polling showing it's top of mind for some voters, could it sway federal election votes?

title.children: Dutton is campaigning on crime. In some seats voters say it's a top concern

image.altText: A young woman in white pants scrolls on her phone.

props.synopsis: Advocates say social media is a "lifeline" for young people with disability, so they should be part of designing and testing elements of the federal government's ban.

title.children: Fears social media ban will strip kids with disability of 'lifeline'

image.altText: A bilby.

props.synopsis: Years of fires, landclearing and introduced predators have seen Australia's bilby population plummet but a glimmer of hope exists within six protected areas.

title.children: Sacrificing sleep to search for bilbies under the stars
